adjective.description: Having powerful hands. Usually figurative: forceful, imperious; able or willing to use force or to act firmly and decisively.
Nautical. Having a good complement of hands to sail the vessel in question. Now rare.
North American (now historical). Having substantial financial resources.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Stephen Gosson (bap. 1554, d. 1625), anti-theatrical polemicist and Church of England clergyman. From strong + hand + -ed;.
